## inputs.Input.insertFieldAt() method

Inserts a field (or label from string), and all prefix and suffix fields, at the location of the input's field row.

**Signature:**

```typescript
insertFieldAt<T>(index: number, field: string | Field<T>, opt_name?: string): number;
```

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

index


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

The index at which to insert field.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

field


</td><td>

string \| [Field](./blockly.field_class.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;


</td><td>

Something to add as a field.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_name


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Language-neutral identifier which may used to find this field again. Should be unique to the host block.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

number

The index following the last inserted field.
